content: John Kugelman has marked this topic as resolved.

I do find JoinHandle::join() being #[must_use](because Result is #[must_use]) an annoyance sometimes, as I sometimes just care that the thread finished running and not if the thread has panicked or not
Maybe we should add #[not_must_use] to negate type's #[must_use]
The fun part about let _ and guards is that it can be exactly the thing you don't want to use to silence must_use. Not in the thread join case. but for mutexes for example.
because it drops immediately instead of the end of scope.
